content.description:
Climb up a tricky face to some easy climbing. Another tricky section pulling right around a bulge with hard-to-find holds.

5-10 feet left of the easy scramble which leads to the grassy ledge of the Upper Bookend
bolts, bolted anchor

Climb easily up to a horizontal break. Step right to gain some sidepulls then fire a short crux and onto easier climbing.

Scramble up onto a big grassy ledge. This is the leftmost route off that ledge.
bolts, bolted anchor

Climb up passing an arête and trending right near the top.

First bolted line at the left end of the crag
3 bolts, bolted anchor

Tricky crux around the first bolt and another midway up.  I would recommend a stick clip.


Starting at the off-width which is formed between the main wall and the Chamcook boulder and moving right this is the second bolted line.

Bolted Anchor

Start about 3m left and uphill from Top Gun. Stick clip a high first bolt and boulder up past the blocky overhang to gain the face above. Follow shallow corners to the anchor.

bolts, bolted anchor

Climb an arete to the prow above. Make use of the dirty slab on the left to pull over the prow and finish on the slab to its right

bolts, bolted anchor

A tough and somewhat awkward boulder problem gains the easy slab. The start is quite hard for the grade.

The arete and slab left of Forest Dump. Starts at a low overhang.
4 bolts. rap rings

Climb up the blocky looking rock. Near the right end of the cliff is a big corner. The blocky right side of the corner has 2 bolted routes. This one is the left one.
If taking the flagged trail to get to the cliff, you will arrive at a large boulder called the Chamcook boulder. The routes in this area are in the corner behind this boulder. bolts, bolted anchor

A short bolted face left of the blocky chimney.

3 bolts, bolted anchor

Follow a series of small corners to the base of the obvious, steep overhang. Reach for the large jug - this is where the fun begins. Make athletic moves up the right side of the overhang then keep your cool on the rounded arête.

A prominent line up an impressive overhanging panel. It's surprising it took so long for this route to get developed.

This route climbs the right side of the overhanging panel of rock between Space Invaders and The Grotto.
7 bolts, rap rings

Climb up the detached block and face above.

Scramble up onto a big grassy ledge. This is the rightmost route that climbs from this ledge. 

5 bolts, bolted anchor (Quick Clips)

Climb up blocky overhanging rock to the face above. The crux is down low but don't let your guard down!

Near the left end of the crag. Hike left past Top Gun and Danger Zone to the next bolted line up the blocky overhanging rock.
bolts, bolted anchor

Climb interesting blocky features to the face above and a crux near the top.

The face just right of a blank overhanging shield of rock 45ft off the ground.
bolts, bolted anchor

Climb the blocky looking rock to an arete. Near the right end of the cliff is a big corner. The blocky face on the right has 2 routes. This is the one on the right. Currently the rightmost route on the entire cliff.
If taking the flagged trail to get to the cliff, you will arrive at a large boulder called the Chamcook boulder. The routes in this area are in the corner behind this boulder. bolts, bolted anchor

Climb up the face past a couple tricky bulges. Crux is pulling the second bulge.

bolted line to the right of the chimney/corner
bolts, bolted anchor

Climb the slab just left of the arête past 2 bolts. Continue up the slab, placing gear and eventually ending on a nice ledge with bolted anchor If taking the flagged trail to get to the cliff, you will arrive at a large boulder called the Chamcook boulder. The routes in this area are in the corner behind this boulder.
Laid-Off climbs the slab just left of the arete. 2 bolts, mostly finger sized pieces in various cracks.

An excellent climb up the beautiful face. Crux is down low and the climbing eases afterwards. Stick clip the high first bolt and start on top of the giant tree stump. The small holds on the initial section of wall can be very hard to see. The climbing feels more reasonable once you find them! Near the right end of the cliff is a big corner. The beautiful left face face of this corner has 3 routes. Lemonade is the line in the middle, starting on the huge tree stump.
If taking the flagged trail to get to the cliff, you will arrive at a large boulder called the Chamcook boulder. The routes in this area are in the corner behind this boulder. bolts, quick clip anchor

While shorter than its neighbour, Limeade is more sustained. Climb easily to the first bolt then follow straight up the bolt line past some shallow pockets, crimps and sidepulls. Very technical. Near the right end of the cliff is a big corner. The beautiful left face face of this corner has 3 routes. Limeade is the one on the left.
If taking the flagged trail to get to the cliff, you will arrive at a large boulder called the Chamcook boulder. The routes in this area are in the corner behind this boulder. bolts, quick clip anchor

Face climbing that's trickier than it looks leads to the left side of the roof. Pull over the roof then easy climbing to the anchor.

Scramble up onto a big grassy ledge. This route climbs the left side of the obvious roof.

5 bolts, bolted anchor (quick clips)

climbs.name: Miss Conception
climbs.fa: F. Berube, M. Keays, E. Burley 2008

content.description:
A tricky start move on some pockets leads to your first bolt and a long run out to the second.  Luckily the run out is extremely easy.  Climb through some thought provoking moves in the middle section to reach a small overhang.  Pull through this and climb the slab to the top.

CAUTION:  The overhang at the top is split by a crack which the rope will fall into.  This makes for a less than ideal top rope.  It also makes it a pain when pulling your rope or lowering.

Located on the same wall as Indians and Cowboys this route it to the far right.  If you pass an access gully with a fixed line you have gone too far.
Bolted Anchor

Climb up to the right side of the roof where a fun crux section awaits.

Scramble up onto a big grassy ledge. There are two routes that go through the obvious roof. This is the one going through the right side of the roof

5 bolts. bolted anchor (quick clips)

Climb up the face and corner.

Just left of the easy scramble which leads to the grassy ledge of the Upper Bookend.
bolts, bolted anchor

A classic route which zig-zags up the wall past some very interesting features. Start a few feet left of the corner crack/chimney and right of a very large tree stump. Angle up and left across a tricky face to gain the left side of an undercling flake/roof. Traverse up and right on underclings until it turns into a small corner. Pull onto the face above, clip a bolt and move left to a vertical seam. Above the seam you will reach better holds. At this point you will be near the anchors for Lemonade on your left. Climb up and right, gaining a small ledge and a set of quick clips. Near the right end of the cliff is a big corner. The beautiful left face face of this corner has 3 routes. Scurvy is the rightmost one.
If taking the flagged trail to get to the cliff, you will arrive at a large boulder called the Chamcook boulder. The routes in this area are in the corner behind this boulder. bolts, quick clip anchor.

Climb up the easy chimney.

The obvious chimney right of Forest Dump
standard rack, bolted anchor

An obvious line which Ironically climbs close to its neighbouring routes in a few spots. Climb the face and arête left of Limeade as it slowly arcs right, passing an obvious pocket on the way to the Limeade anchor. Tricky start but the climbing eases the higher you go. After the third bolt, either run it out to the anchor or clip the last bolt of Limeade.

Find the beautiful face with Scurvy, Lemonade and Limeade, behind the large boulder. This route climbs the arête on the left edge of the wall.
3 or 4 bolts, quick clip anchor.

Climb up to the corner and overhang. Pull a few moves up the overhang. From here, most people climb up and left on jugs then follow more jugs on the arête trending back to the right, clipping a bolt a full arm's length to the right. 

Climbing Directly up the corner was the intention of the FA and makes for a fun and harder sequence which bumps the grade up to 5.11d

Immediately left of the blank overhanging shield of rock about 50ft off the ground.
bolts, bolted anchor

Start up easy blocky rock to gain the overhang. Climb the overhanging face on mostly good holds until you reach huge jugs where the angle eases. Continue up easy (and likely dirty) terrain to a bolted anchor.

Just left of Space Invaders
bolts, bolted anchor

Climb the short face past some overhangs.

Far left end of the crag. Second bolted line.
3 bolts, bolted anchor

A bouldery start leads to easier climbing up top.  Unfortunately this route is in desperate need of a scrub so the easier top feels about as hard as the bottom.



Starting at the far left of the cliff and moving right this is the third bolted line on the right.  Look for a large detached block/pillar which marks the start of this climb.  

3 bolts, single rack .3 to 2.  Rap Rings

Climb the vertical crack to the left of Miss Conception.  Bolted anchor at the top of the route.  Rappel recomended.



Obvious vertical crack on the bookend face between two bolted routes.  

Bolted anchor with rap rings.

This basalt crag near the town of Saint Andrews has between 30 and 40 single pitch routes, most of which are well bolted sport climbs. Grades range from easy 5.3 trad climbs to mid 5.12 with most routes falling somewhere in the middle. Due to its location being further from Fredericton and Saint John compared to Welsford, Greenlaw sees little traffic and unfortunately some of the routes are not as clean as they once were. Nevertheless, this crag is definitely worth the visit and has a few classic climbs that are worth the effort to get to. 
 This crag is on private land so be mindful and respectful and leave no trace.
